comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article2456104 this Canberra Times article lists the Stevens cabinet following the 1938 state election...in the following months, Dunningham died and Stevens passed on the position of Treasurer, necessitating a few portfolio changes... All these politicians look the same! I can only identify a couple of them...I'm guessing with the others! If I've made any mistakes please make corrections and I'll remove any offending note. Looks like Fitzsimons might have been absent when this pic was taken... Michael Frederick Bruxner (Deputy Premier; Transport) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... David Henry Drummond (Education) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Herbert Paton Fitzsimons (Health) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... George Charles Gollan (Col Sec) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Herbert Middleton Hawkins (Labour & Industry) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Alexander Mair (Treasurer) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Henry Edward Manning (Attorney-General) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Lewis Ormsby Martin (Justice) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Albert David Reid (Agriculture) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Athol Railton Richardson (Social Services/?Health) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Colin Archibald Sinclair (Lands) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Eric Sydney Spooner (Public Works/Local Government) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Bertram Sydney Barnsdale Stevens (Premier) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Roy Stanley Vincent (Mines/Forests) www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... In this pic, given the lighting issues, Sam Hood probably had to use a wider aperture and slower shutter speed than he might have liked...which means there's not enough depth of field to get them all in focus, and there's also just a touch of motion blur. But the Premier's fine, so who cares!
